2@s

26 Nov 2013

For all those whose want to repair their a Xperia P:

Connect your phone to PC.

Open PC Companion.

It will check for updates and display Your phone is up to date.

Click on Your phone is upto date.

A dialog box will show you to repair.

Click on repair.

And follow the on screen options.

Reply

AnonD-209029

mPA

23 Nov 2013

read before buy, 21 Nov 2013Overall a good phone with good camera, but it gets a bit laggy even after update. I have anoth... moreI've noticed the water/moisture in the transparent bit of my phone, too, but don't pay much attention to it, as it doesn't affect the functionality of the phone at all.

It's a great phone, though. Occasionally, a lag issue comes up - but that's very rare. Once or twice, it froze and I had to wait for it to restart and get itself together.. but that last happened a ridiculously long time ago.

Also, I've dropped the phone quite a few times - several times with the screen down, and it's still perfect. Only a couple of small scratches on the back, and the corners are a little damaged, but that's because I don't use a case.

Overall, it's a fantastic phone. I've had it for over a year and loved it. Now, I'm picking out good phones for my little sister to choose from - looking at lots of new, pretty models - and I still haven't found one that would replace my Xperia P for me. Would pick it with its great personalizable Android OS over an iPhone any day!

Reply
